L1:

L1:
* Understand relational database concepts (tables, rows, columns)

* Understand basic data types (INT, VARCHAR, DATE)
* Perform simple filtering and sorting
L2:
* Write complex SQL queries with JOIN, GROUP BY, HAVING, UNION
* Create and manage views for reporting
* Use stored procedures and functions for data transformation
* Schedule data extraction jobs
* Connect MySQL to BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker)
* Handle data quality issues (nulls, duplicates, type mismatches)
L3:
* Design normalized and denormalized schemas for analytics
* Optimize queries using indexing and execution plans
* Implement data security (user roles, access control)
* Automate data pipelines using orchestration tools
* Integrate MySQL with real-time data sources and APIs
* Monitor and troubleshoot performance issues

L3:

* Automate data pipelines using orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Cloud Composer)
* Implement encryption, backups, and failover strategies
* Optimize queries and indexing for performance
* Integrate Cloud SQL with real-time data sources and APIs

L1:
* Understands basic Tally ERP modules (Accounting, Inventory).
* Can manually export data (Excel, PDF).

* Knows simple reporting techniques.
* Aware of basic data privacy principles.

L2:

* Uses ODBC/XML interfaces and connector tools for data extraction.

* Automates data extraction using APIs and scripting (e.g., Python).
* Designs scalable data pipelines with error handling.
* Maintains full ETL workflows into enterprise data warehouses.
* Creates dynamic, automated reporting systems.

L1:
* Understands basic types of unstructured data (Word, Excel, PDFs).
* Can manually locate and open documents for data review.
* Performs basic copy-paste or manual extraction of data.
* Uses simple Excel functions for organizing extracted data.
* Aware of file formats and basic storage practices.
L2:
* Identifies relevant data within unstructured documents using search and filters.
* Uses tools like Power Query, Python (pandas), or Excel macros for semi-automated extraction.
* Cleans and structures data for analysis (e.g., tabular format).
* Understands metadata and document properties.
* Collaborates with teams to standardize document formats and naming conventions.
L3:
* Automates data extraction using NLP or document parsing libraries (e.g., Python with docx, pdfplumber, openpyxl).
* Designs workflows to convert unstructured data into structured formats for databases or dashboards.
* Implements document classification and tagging systems.
* Ensures data quality, version control, and compliance in document handling.
* Leads initiatives to integrate unstructured data into enterprise data platforms.

L1:
* Recognizes basic image file formats (JPEG, PNG, TIFF).
* Manually reviews images for visible data (e.g., scanned invoices, receipts).
* Uses basic tools (e.g., Snipping Tool, Paint) to extract or annotate data.
* Understands limitations of image data in analysis.
* Aware of basic image storage and organization practices.
L2:
* Uses OCR tools (e.g., Tesseract, Adobe Acrobat) to extract text from images.
* Applies image pre-processing techniques (e.g., resizing, contrast adjustment).
* Cleans and structures extracted data for use in spreadsheets or databases.
* Understands image metadata (e.g., resolution, timestamps).
* Collaborates with teams to standardize image formats and naming conventions.
L3:
* Automates image data extraction using advanced OCR and computer vision libraries (e.g., OpenCV, EasyOCR).
* Designs pipelines to process large volumes of image data efficiently.
* Integrates image data into structured databases or analytics platforms.
* Implements quality checks, version control, and compliance for image data.
* Leads initiatives involving image classification, tagging, and AI-based recognition.

L1:
* Understands what Azure Blob Storage is and its role in storing unstructured data.
* Can manually upload/download files using Azure Portal.
* Recognizes basic blob types (Block, Append, Page).
* Aware of file formats commonly stored (e.g., images, documents, logs).
* Follows basic naming and folder conventions.
L2:
* Uses Azure Storage Explorer or CLI to manage blobs.
* Applies filters and metadata to organize and retrieve blobs.
* Extracts data from blobs using scripts or tools (e.g., Python with azure-storage-blob).
* Understands access tiers and lifecycle management.
* Collaborates with teams to define blob structure and access policies.
L3:
* Automates blob data ingestion into data pipelines using Azure Functions, Logic Apps, or Data Factory.
* Implements secure access using SAS tokens, RBAC, and encryption.
* Designs scalable workflows for processing large volumes of unstructured blob data.
* Integrates blob data with analytics platforms (e.g., Synapse, Databricks).
* Leads governance, compliance, and optimization strategies for blob storage usage.

L1:
* Understands what PDF files are and their common use cases (e.g., invoices, reports).
* Can manually open and review PDF documents.
* Performs basic copy-paste operations to extract data.
* Uses simple tools like Adobe Reader or browser-based viewers.
* Aware of file organization and naming conventions.
L2:
* Uses PDF extraction tools (e.g., Adobe Acrobat, Tabula, Power BI PDF connector).
* Applies semi-automated methods to extract tabular or textual data.
* Cleans and structures extracted data using Excel or scripting tools.
* Understands PDF metadata and document properties.
* Collaborates with teams to standardize PDF formats for easier processing.
L3:
* Automates PDF data extraction using libraries like pdfplumber, PyMuPDF, or PDFMiner.
* Designs workflows to process large volumes of PDFs efficiently.
* Integrates extracted data into structured databases or analytics platforms.
* Implements document classification, tagging, and version control.
* Ensures compliance with data governance and leads initiatives for intelligent document processing (IDP).

L1:
* Understands what APIs are and their role in data exchange.
* Can use Postman to send basic GET requests.
* Reads simple JSON responses and identifies key-value pairs.
* Manually copies response data for analysis.
* Aware of basic API documentation and endpoints.
L2:
* Uses Postman to send various request types (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).
* Adds headers, query parameters, and body payloads to requests.
* Extracts and saves response data using Postman collections and environments.
* Understands authentication methods (e.g., API keys, Bearer tokens).
* Collaborates with developers to test and refine API endpoints.
L3:
* Automates API workflows using Postman scripts (Pre-request & Tests).
* Integrates Postman with CI/CD tools or data pipelines.
* Handles complex authentication (OAuth 2.0, JWT).
* Parses and transforms API responses for direct integration into databases or dashboards.
* Leads API documentation reviews and contributes to API design for data engineering needs.

L1:
* Understands basic concepts of APIs and RESTful services.
* Can use Postman to send simple GET requests and view responses.
* Opens Swagger UI to explore available endpoints.
* Reads basic JSON responses and identifies key fields.
* Aware of API documentation and its purpose.
L2:
* Uses Postman to send various request types (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) with headers and payloads.
* Navigates Swagger UI to test endpoints and understand parameters.
* Extracts and saves response data for analysis.
* Understands authentication methods (API keys, Bearer tokens).
* Collaborates with developers to troubleshoot and refine API usage.
L3:
* Automates API workflows using Postman scripting and environments.
* Integrates Swagger-generated client code into data pipelines.
* Handles complex authentication (OAuth 2.0, JWT) and error handling.
* Parses and transforms API responses for direct integration into databases or dashboards.
* Leads API integration strategies and contributes to API design and documentation.

L1:
* Understands basic API concepts and how Postman is used for testing.
* Can send simple requests (GET/POST) and view responses in Postman.

L1:
* Uses pandas to explore data and identify basic anomalies (e.g., missing values, duplicates).
* Applies simple statistical summaries (mean(), std(), describe()) to spot outliers.
* Uses conditional filtering to isolate unusual values (e.g., values outside expected ranges).
* Understands basic concepts of anomalies and their impact on analysis.
L2:
* Implements rule-based anomaly detection using thresholds and z-scores ((x - mean) / std).
* Uses numpy for efficient numerical operations and outlier detection.
* Applies interquartile range (IQR) method to detect outliers.
* Builds reusable functions to automate anomaly detection across datasets.
L3:
* Designs scalable anomaly detection workflows using statistical and algorithmic approaches.
* Combines multiple techniques (e.g., rolling statistics, time-series decomposition) for dynamic anomaly detection.
* Integrates anomaly detection into data pipelines for real-time monitoring.
* Visualizes anomalies using matplotlib and seaborn (e.g., box plots, time-series plots).
* Prepares data for machine learning-based anomaly detection models (e.g., isolation forest, DBSCAN).

L1:
* Understands basic statistical concepts (mean, variance, standard deviation).

L2:

L3:
* Designs robust anomaly detection pipelines using advanced time-series models (e.g., SARIMA, VAR).
* Implements outlier detection using influence measures (e.g., Cook’s distance, leverage).
* Automates anomaly detection in forecasting models with confidence intervals and prediction errors.
* Integrates Statsmodels with visualization tools to highlight anomalies in dashboards or reports.

Tools:
Python (scikit-learn, xgboost, lightgbm, optuna, hyperopt, ray[tune], keras-tuner
)
L1:
* Use scikit-learn for basic hyperparameter tuning (e.g., GridSearchCV, RandomizedSearchCV)
* Tune simple models like decision trees, logistic regression
* Understand evaluation metrics and their role in tuning

* Apply basic tuning to xgboost and lightgbm using default parameters
L2:
* Use optuna and hyperopt for automated hyperparameter optimization
* Apply Bayesian optimization and early stopping techniques
* Tune ensemble models (xgboost, lightgbm) with custom parameter grids
* Use keras-tuner for optimizing neural network architectures
* Integrate tuning workflows with cross-validation and pipelines
* Visualize optimization history and parameter importance
L3:
* Use ray[tune] for distributed and scalable hyperparameter tuning
* Implement custom objective functions and search spaces in optuna and hyperopt
* Optimize deep learning models with complex architectures using keras-tuner
* Combine multiple tuning strategies (e.g., Bayesian + grid search)
* Automate tuning workflows in production ML pipelines
* Monitor tuning performance and convergence using advanced visualizations

L1:

L1:
* Understands basic data formats (CSV, JSON, Avro, etc.).
* Recognizes the importance of data completeness and accuracy.
* Identifies missing or inconsistent values manually.
* Understands the concept of a Global ID or unique identifier in datasets.
L2:
* Validates data formats and schema consistency during ingestion.
* Implements basic data profiling to assess completeness and accuracy.
* Uses SQL to detect duplicates, nulls, and outliers.
* Applies Global ID logic to join and deduplicate datasets reliably.
L3:
* Designs automated data quality checks in ingestion pipelines.
* Implements anomaly detection and data validation rules using BigQuery SQL and scripting.
* Uses tools like Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for sensitive data scanning.
* Ensures referential integrity and consistency across integrated datasets using Global IDs.
* Builds dashboards to monitor data quality metrics in real-time.

L1:
* Understands basic data formats supported by Talend (CSV, Excel, JSON, XML).
* Loads and previews data using Talend Studio.
* Identifies missing or malformed data manually.
* Uses basic Talend components like tFileInputDelimited, tLogRow, and tFilterRow.
L2:
* Validates schema consistency and data types during ingestion.
* Uses Talend components like tSchemaComplianceCheck and tMap for data transformation and validation.
* Implements rules to check completeness (e.g., mandatory fields) and accuracy (e.g., value ranges).
* Applies deduplication and standardization using tUniqRow, tNormalize, and tDenormalize.
L3:
* Designs automated data quality workflows using Talend Data Quality tools.
* Implements profiling, cleansing, and enrichment using Talend DQ components (tMatchGroup, tDataQualityRules).
* Integrates Talend with external metadata repositories and data catalogs for quality monitoring.
* Builds reusable jobs for continuous data quality checks across pipelines.
* Uses Talend’s Global ID strategy for entity resolution and master data management.

L1:
* Understands common data formats supported by Informatica (CSV, XML, JSON, Excel).
* Loads and previews data using Informatica PowerCenter or Cloud Data Integration.
* Identifies missing or incorrect values manually during mapping design.
* Uses basic transformations like Expression, Filter, and Lookup to inspect data.
L2:
* Applies data validation rules using transformations (Router, Aggregator, Rank).
* Implements completeness checks (e.g., mandatory fields, null handling).
* Uses Informatica Data Quality (IDQ) tools for profiling and cleansing.
* Applies deduplication and standardization using Match and Cleanse transformations.
* Designs reusable mappings for consistent data quality enforcement.
L3:
* Builds automated data quality workflows using Informatica Data Quality and Axon.
* Implements advanced profiling, rule-based cleansing, and exception handling.
* Integrates Informatica with metadata repositories and data governance tools.
* Uses Global ID strategies for master data management and entity resolution.
* Monitors data quality metrics and builds dashboards for continuous improvement.

L1:

L2:

L3:

L1:
* Understands basic data formats (CSV, Excel, JSON) and loads them using pandas.

L2:

L1:
* Understands the concept of duplicates and basic inconsistency issues in datasets.
* Learns the importance of a Global ID (unique identifier) for record tracking.
* Uses simple filters and conditional logic to identify duplicate rows.
* Recognizes inconsistent formats (e.g., date formats, casing) manually.
L2:
* Applies deduplication techniques using tools or SQL logic (e.g., ROW_NUMBER(), DISTINCT, fuzzy matching).
* Implements Global ID logic to join datasets and resolve identity conflicts.
* Uses validation rules to detect inconsistencies in values, formats, and relationships.
* Builds reusable scripts or components to standardize and clean data.
L3:
* Designs entity resolution frameworks using Global ID strategies across systems.
* Implements probabilistic matching and clustering to detect near-duplicates.
* Automates inconsistency detection using rule engines or data quality libraries.
* Integrates Global ID logic into master data management (MDM) workflows.
* Builds monitoring systems to track duplicate rates and inconsistency trends over time.

L1:
* Uses pandas to identify exact duplicates (duplicated(), drop_duplicates()).

* Learns the purpose of fuzzy matching and record linkage in resolving duplicates.
* Applies simple filtering and conditional logic to spot inconsistencies.
L2:
* Uses fuzzywuzzy to detect near-duplicate strings (e.g., names, addresses).
* Applies recordlinkage to compare datasets and identify potential matches using blocking and comparison techniques.
* Implements deduplication logic using similarity scores and thresholds.
* Builds reusable functions to clean and standardize inconsistent data formats.
L3:
* Designs entity resolution workflows combining pandas, fuzzywuzzy, and recordlinkage.
* Implements probabilistic matching models and custom comparison strategies.
* Automates inconsistency detection across large datasets using scalable logic.
* Integrates Global ID generation and matching logic for master data management.
* Builds dashboards or reports to monitor duplicate rates and data consistency over time.

L1:

L2:
* Uses clustering algorithms (e.g., key collision, nearest neighbor) to detect near-duplicates.
* Applies transformations using GREL (General Refine Expression Language) for standardization.
* Resolves inconsistencies in formats (e.g., dates, names) using custom expressions.
* Combines multiple columns to create or validate Global IDs.
L3:
* Designs complex workflows for deduplication and inconsistency resolution.
* Automates data cleaning using OpenRefine scripts and reconciliation services.
* Integrates OpenRefine with external APIs or knowledge bases for entity resolution.
* Uses Global ID strategies to link and merge records across datasets.
* Exports cleaned data for downstream integration with other tools or pipelines.

L1:

L2:
* Configures Griffin’s DSL (Domain Specific Language) to define rules for detecting duplicates and inconsistencies.
* Implements uniqueness checks using Global ID logic across datasets.
* Uses Griffin’s profiling capabilities to identify patterns and anomalies.
* Integrates Griffin with data sources like Hive, HDFS, or Kafka for quality checks
L3:

* Implements entity resolution strategies using Global IDs and rule-based matching.

* Understands the concept of fine-tuning and its importance for domain adaptation.
* Can load pre-trained models using Hugging Face Transformers.
* Familiar with basic usage of OpenAI and Anthropic APIs for prompt-based customization.
* Explores LangChain for chaining prompts and integrating external data sources.
* Understands the difference between prompt tuning and full model fine-tuning.
L2:
* Applies PEFT techniques (e.g., LoRA, Prefix Tuning) to fine-tune models on small domain-specific datasets.
* Uses Hugging Face’s Trainer API or PEFT library to run fine-tuning experiments.
* Fine-tunes open-source models like LLaMA, Mistral, or Falcon using Python scripts.
* Integrates fine-tuned models into LangChain workflows for task-specific applications.
* Evaluates model performance using metrics like accuracy, F1-score, and perplexity.
L3:
* Designs scalable fine-tuning pipelines using PEFT for efficient training on large datasets.
* Fine-tunes models across multiple architectures (e.g., LLaMA, Falcon, Mistral) and compares performance.
* Implements domain-specific adapters and modular fine-tuning strategies.
* Combines fine-tuning with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LangChain agents.
* Benchmarks fine-tuned models against base models using custom evaluation frameworks.
* Deploys fine-tuned models via APIs or integrates them into enterprise applications.

L1:
* Understands the purpose of fine-tuning LLMs for domain-specific tasks.
* Familiar with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and basic Vertex AI services.
* Can use pre-trained models available in Vertex AI for inference.
* Knows how to upload datasets and create basic training jobs via the Vertex AI console.
* Understands the difference between prompt tuning and full model fine-tuning.
L2:
* Fine-tunes models using Vertex AI’s custom training pipelines with Python SDKs.
* Applies PEFT techniques (e.g., LoRA, adapters) using Hugging Face models on Vertex AI.
* Uses Vertex AI Workbench for managing experiments and tracking model performance.
* Integrates domain-specific datasets (e.g., CSV, JSONL) for supervised fine-tuning.
* Deploys fine-tuned models as endpoints and tests them via REST or Python APIs.
L3:
* Designs scalable fine-tuning workflows using Vertex AI Pipelines and custom containers.
* Fine-tunes open-source models (e.g., LLaMA, Falcon, Mistral) using GCP infrastructure.
* Implements advanced optimization techniques (e.g., mixed precision, distributed training).
* Combines fine-tuning with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LangChain agents.
* Monitors and evaluates model performance using Vertex AI Model Monitoring.
* Automates model deployment and versioning using CI/CD workflows on GCP.

L1:

L3:
* Designs scalable fine-tuning workflows using Azure ML Pipelines and custom Docker environments.
* Fine-tunes open-source models (e.g., LLaMA, Falcon, Mistral) using distributed training on Azure.

* Monitors and evaluates model performance using Azure AI Studio’s integrated tools.

L1:
* Understands the purpose of fine-tuning LLMs for domain-specific tasks.
* Familiar with MLflow’s basic components: tracking, projects, models, and registry.
* Can log simple experiments and model parameters using MLflow in Python.
* Uses MLflow to monitor training runs for Hugging Face or OpenAI API-based models.
* Understands how MLflow integrates with tools like LangChain and PEFT for prompt tuning.
L2:
* Fine-tunes models using Hugging Face Transformers and tracks experiments with MLflow.
* Applies PEFT techniques (e.g., LoRA, adapters) and logs hyperparameters, metrics, and artifacts.
* Uses MLflow’s model registry to manage versions of fine-tuned models.
* Integrates MLflow with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP) for scalable training.
* Implements MLflow Projects for reproducible fine-tuning workflows.
L3:
* Designs end-to-end fine-tuning pipelines with MLflow for LLMs like LLaMA, Falcon, and Mistral.
* Automates experiment tracking, model evaluation, and deployment using MLflow and CI/CD tools.
* Combines MLflow with LangChain agents and RAG systems for domain-specific applications.
* Implements custom MLflow plugins or extensions for advanced logging and visualization.
* Benchmarks fine-tuned models across multiple domains and integrates with enterprise MLOps workflows.

L1:
* Understands the concept of fine-tuning and its role in customizing LLMs.
* Familiar with using JavaScript/TypeScript to interact with LLM APIs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic).
* Can send basic prompts and receive responses using fetch, axios, or SDKs.
* Uses pre-trained models for inference in web apps or Node.js environments.
* Understands limitations of fine-tuning directly in JS/TS and the need for backend support.
L2:
* Integrates domain-specific data into prompt engineering workflows using JS/TS.
* Uses frameworks like LangChain.js or custom wrappers to build prompt pipelines.
* Interfaces with backend services (Python, REST APIs) that handle actual fine-tuning.
* Implements caching, logging, and versioning of prompts and responses.
* Builds UI components to test and evaluate model outputs across different domains.
L3:
* Designs full-stack systems where JS/TS frontends interact with fine-tuned models hosted via APIs.
* Uses LangChain.js or custom agents to orchestrate multi-step reasoning and tool use.
* Implements feedback loops from user interactions to inform future fine-tuning cycles.
* Coordinates with backend systems (e.g., Python ML pipelines) for PEFT or full fine-tuning.
* Builds dashboards for monitoring model performance, user feedback, and domain adaptation metrics.

Sub-Sub-Category: Transfer learning and adapter models (LoRA, PEFT)
Tools: Python (hugging Face Transformers, PEFT, OpenAI API,  Anthropic API, LLaMA / Mistral / Falcon, LangChain)
L1:
* Understands the concept of transfer learning and adapter-based fine-tuning.
* Familiar with Hugging Face Transformers and basic model loading in Python.
* Can use OpenAI and Anthropic APIs for prompt-based customization.
* Knows what LoRA and PEFT are and their role in efficient fine-tuning.
* Explores LangChain for chaining prompts and basic model orchestration.
L2:
* Applies LoRA and PEFT techniques to fine-tune models like LLaMA, Mistral, or Falcon using Hugging Face.
* Uses Hugging Face’s Trainer or PEFT library to run adapter-based training.
* Understands how to freeze base model layers and train only adapters.
* Integrates fine-tuned models into LangChain workflows for domain-specific tasks.
* Evaluates model performance using metrics like accuracy, loss, and perplexity.
L3:
* Designs scalable fine-tuning pipelines using PEFT for large-scale domain adaptation.
* Implements LoRA and other adapter strategies across multiple architectures (e.g., Falcon, Mistral).
* Combines adapter models with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and LangChain agents.
* Benchmarks adapter-based models against full fine-tuning approaches.
* Automates training, evaluation, and deployment using Python-based MLOps tools.
* Contributes to internal libraries or frameworks for adapter-based fine-tuning.

Sub-Sub-Category: Transfer learning and adapter models (LoRA, PEFT)
L1:
* Understands the basics of transfer learning and adapter models like LoRA and PEFT.
* Familiar with Weights & Biases dashboard for tracking experiments.

Tools: Python (label Studio, Prodigy, Numpy, Snorkel, GPT APIs, Text Attack, Hugging Face datasets)
L1:
* Understands the importance of clean, labeled data for fine-tuning LLMs.
* Can load and explore datasets using Hugging Face datasets library and NumPy.
* Uses basic annotation tools like Label Studio or Prodigy for manual labeling.
* Familiar with GPT APIs for generating synthetic examples or augmenting small datasets.
* Understands basic data formats (CSV, JSON, JSONL) and preprocessing steps.
L2:
* Applies data augmentation techniques using GPT APIs and libraries like TextAttack.
* Uses Snorkel for weak supervision and programmatic labeling of unlabeled data.
* Builds custom labeling workflows using Label Studio or Prodigy with Python integration.
* Cleans and transforms datasets using NumPy and Hugging Face datasets for model training.
* Combines multiple data sources and formats into unified training datasets.
L3:
* Designs scalable data pipelines for domain-specific dataset preparation and augmentation.
* Implements advanced augmentation strategies (e.g., adversarial examples, paraphrasing, contrast sets).
* Uses Snorkel for building labeling functions and applying probabilistic labels.
* Automates dataset versioning, validation, and quality checks using Python.
* Integrates dataset workflows with MLOps tools and fine-tuning pipelines (e.g., PEFT, LangChain).
* Contributes to internal data libraries or frameworks for reusable dataset components.

L3:
* Designs distributed data augmentation pipelines using Apache Spark with Scala.
* Implements advanced augmentation strategies (e.g., adversarial examples, contrastive data) in Scala.
* Builds Scala-based microservices for real-time data preprocessing and augmentation.

Sub-Sub-Category: Combining text, image, audio, and video inputs
L1:
* Understands the concept of multimodal AI and the capabilities of GPT-4 (Vision).
* Can input and interpret basic text and image prompts using GPT-4.
* Familiar with supported input formats (e.g., PNG, JPEG, text).
* Uses GPT-4 for simple tasks like image captioning, OCR, and visual Q&A.
* Understands limitations of GPT-4 in handling audio and video directly.
L2:
* Combines text and image inputs for more complex tasks (e.g., document analysis, UI interpretation).
* Uses external tools to convert audio/video into text or image formats for GPT-4 processing.
* Designs multimodal workflows using GPT-4 Vision in Python or via API.
* Applies GPT-4 to real-world use cases like accessibility, education, and content moderation.
* Understands how to structure multimodal prompts for optimal performance.
L3:
* Builds end-to-end multimodal systems integrating GPT-4 with audio (ASR), video (frame extraction), and image pipelines.
* Implements multimodal reasoning tasks (e.g., combining visual and textual context for decision-making).
* Fine-tunes multimodal workflows using GPT-4 in combination with other models (e.g., Whisper for audio, CLIP for image-text alignment).
* Designs scalable applications (e.g., multimodal chatbots, assistive tech) using GPT-4 APIs.
* Benchmarks GPT-4’s multimodal capabilities against other models and optimizes input formatting for performance.

Sub-Sub-Category: Combining text, image, audio, and video inputs
L1:
* Understands the concept of multimodal AI and Gemini’s role in combining different data types.
* Can use Gemini via the chatbot interface to process text and image inputs.
* Familiar with basic tasks like image captioning, text generation, and speech recognition.
* Explores Gemini Nano for on-device multimodal tasks (e.g., summarizing recordings, smart replies)
L2:
* Uses Gemini Pro to combine text, image, audio, and video inputs for more complex tasks.
* Applies Gemini to real-world use cases like document summarization, video analysis, and multilingual translation .
* Integrates Gemini with Google Workspace tools (Docs, Slides, Meet) for multimodal productivity (e.g., generating images from text, summarizing Drive documents) .
* Understands Gemini’s ability to interpret sketches, respond to video frames, and generate interactive content .
L3:
* Leverages Gemini Ultra for high-complexity multimodal reasoning tasks across domains like science, law, and coding.
* Designs agentic workflows using Gemini 2.0 models (Pro, Flash, Flash-Lite) that interact with external tools and APIs.
* Builds applications that combine real-time inputs from text, image, audio, and video for dynamic decision-making.
* Benchmarks Gemini’s multimodal performance using academic standards (e.g., MMLU, MMMU) and integrates it into enterprise-grade systems.
* Uses Gemini’s extended memory and long-context capabilities (up to 2 million tokens) for deep multimodal analysis .

Sub-Sub-Category: Combining text, image, audio, and video inputs
Tools: JSON, JSONL, MP4, WAV, PNG, JPG
L1:
* Understands the role of different data types (text, image, audio, video) in multimodal AI.
* Familiar with basic file formats:
    * Text: JSON, JSONL
    * Image: PNG, JPG
    * Audio: WAV
    * Video: MP4
* Can load and preview these formats using simple Python or web tools.
* Uses JSON/JSONL for storing structured text data and annotations.
* Understands how to convert files between formats using basic tools.
L2:
* Preprocesses and validates multimodal datasets using Python libraries (e.g., json, PIL, librosa, moviepy).
* Combines text annotations (JSON/JSONL) with corresponding media files (PNG, MP4, WAV) for training multimodal models.
* Uses tools like Hugging Face Datasets to manage and load multimodal data.
* Applies basic transformations (e.g., resizing images, trimming audio, extracting video frames).
* Understands how to structure multimodal datasets for input into models like GPT-4 Vision or Gemini.
L3:
* Designs scalable pipelines for multimodal dataset ingestion, preprocessing, and augmentation.
* Implements synchronization between modalities (e.g., aligning audio with video, text with image regions).
* Uses advanced tools (e.g., FFmpeg, OpenCV, PyDub) to manipulate MP4, WAV, PNG, and JPG files.
* Builds multimodal training datasets with rich metadata in JSON/JSONL formats.
* Integrates multimodal data into Gen AI workflows (e.g., RAG, agentic systems, multimodal reasoning).
* Benchmarks model performance across modalities and formats using custom evaluation scripts.

Sub-Sub-Category: Combining text, image, audio, and video inputs
L1:
* Understands the concept of multimodal AI and LangChain’s role in orchestrating LLM workflows.

L2:
* Builds multimodal chains that combine text with image, audio, or video-derived inputs.
* Uses external tools (e.g., Whisper for audio transcription, OpenCV for video frame extraction) to convert non-text inputs into text for LangChain processing.
* Integrates LangChain with APIs or local tools to handle image captioning, OCR, and audio transcription.
* Designs workflows that use LangChain agents to reason across modalities (e.g., interpreting a chart and answering questions).
L3:
* Develops complex multimodal pipelines using LangChain agents, tools, and memory modules.
* Combines real-time inputs from text, image, audio, and video sources for dynamic decision-making.
* Integrates LangChain with multimodal models (e.g., GPT-4 Vision, Gemini, Claude) and external libraries (e.g., PyDub, FFmpeg, PIL).
* Implements retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) across modalities (e.g., retrieving relevant video frames or audio clips).
* Benchmarks and optimizes multimodal workflows for latency, accuracy, and contextual coherence.
* Contributes to custom LangChain components or plugins for multimodal orchestration.

Sub-Sub-Category: Combining text, image, audio, and video inputs
L1:
* Understands the concept of multimodal AI and the role of AudioCraft in audio generation.
* Familiar with AudioCraft’s core models:
  * MusicGen – generates music from text prompts.
  * AudioGen – creates sound effects from text (e.g., footsteps, dog barks).
  * EnCodec – compresses and reconstructs audio with high fidelity .
* Can run basic text-to-audio generation tasks using pre-trained models.
* Explores open-source access to AudioCraft via GitHub for experimentation
L2:
* Uses AudioCraft to generate realistic audio for various domains (e.g., gaming, film, virtual environments).
* Combines AudioCraft outputs with other modalities (e.g., syncing generated audio with video or image sequences).
* Customizes text prompts to control style, tone, and duration of generated audio.
* Integrates AudioCraft into Python-based workflows for multimodal applications.
* Begins experimenting with personalized datasets for domain-specific audio generation
L3:
* Designs multimodal pipelines combining AudioCraft with image, video, and text models (e.g., GPT-4 Vision, CLIP).
* Fine-tunes AudioCraft models using custom datasets for specialized sound design.
* Implements real-time multimodal systems (e.g., audio narration for visual scenes, soundscapes for video).
* Benchmarks and optimizes audio quality using metrics like fidelity, coherence, and temporal consistency.
* Contributes to open-source enhancements or plugins for AudioCraft to support broader multimodal use cases

* Applies advanced evaluation metrics (e.g., factuality, toxicity, helpfulness) using custom evaluators.
* Leads governance and compliance efforts by tracking data lineage, model versions, and audit trails.

* Conduct counterfactual analysis to understand decision boundaries and improve model robustness

* Lead governance initiatives by embedding WIT into enterprise AI pipelines for compliance and ethical oversight

   * Install and configure Jenkins locally or on a server.

   * Connect Jenkins to version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab).
   * Trigger builds manually or via source code changes.
   * View build logs and basic job history.
L2:
* Builds automated pipelines and integrates Jenkins with development workflows.
* Able to:
   * Write and manage Declarative Pipelines using Jenkinsfile.
   * Use build triggers, post-build actions, and environment variables.
   * Integrate Jenkins with tools like Docker, SonarQube, and Slack.
   * Configure parameterized builds, artifact archiving, and test reporting.
   * Manage Jenkins plugins for extended functionality.
   * Implement basic security and access control.
L3:
* Architects scalable and secure CI/CD systems using Jenkins.
* Proficient in:
   * Designing complex Scripted Pipelines and shared libraries.
   * Managing distributed builds with agents and nodes.
   * Securing Jenkins with role-based access control, credentials, and audit logging.
   * Integrating Jenkins with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and Kubernetes.
   * Automating deployment workflows across multiple environments.
   * Leading DevOps strategy and mentoring teams on Jenkins best practices.

L1:
* Awareness of CI/CD concepts: Understand what Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment mean.
* Basic GitLab usage: Familiarity with GitLab UI and basic Git operations.
* Simple pipeline creation:
  * Writing basic .gitlab-ci.yml files.
  * Defining simple jobs and stages.
* Using GitLab Runners: Understand what runners are and how they execute jobs.
* Artifact handling: Produce and store build artifacts.
* Merge Request Pipelines: Enable and view basic MR pipelines
L2:
* Pipeline optimization:
  * Use before_script, after_script, needs, and allow_failure keywords.
  * Implement conditional pipelines and workflow rules.
* Testing integration:
  * Define and run unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.
  * Include code coverage jobs.
* Security scanning:
  * Integrate GitLab’s security scanners.
  * Manage secrets and sensitive data.
* Component reuse:
  * Use include, extends, and templates for modular pipeline design.
* Troubleshooting:
  * Read job outputs and debug common errors.
  * Use GitLab Duo for root cause analysis
L3:
* Complex pipeline orchestration:
  * Design multi-project pipelines.
  * Use YAML anchors and inheritance for DRY principles.
* Deployment strategies:
  * Configure deployment rules and environments.
  * Tag builds and manage releases via GitLab UI.
* CI/CD Catalog usage:
  * Create, version, and share reusable CI/CD components.
* Leadership & coaching:
  * Guide others in CI/CD best practices.
  * Customize pipelines for team or organizational needs.
* Thought leadership:
  * Contribute to GitLab CI/CD templates or documentation.
  * Evangelize CI/CD practices across teams

L1:
* Understand GitHub Actions basics:
  * What workflows, jobs, steps, actions, and runners are .
* Create simple workflows:
  * Use .github/workflows directory.
  * Trigger workflows on push or pull requests.
* Use pre-built actions:
  * Integrate basic actions from GitHub Marketplace.
* Run basic CI tasks:
  * Checkout code, install dependencies, run tests.
* Configure secrets:
  * Store and use secrets securely in workflows.
L2:
* Build CI/CD pipelines:
  * Automate testing, linting, and deployment.
* Use matrix builds:
   * Run jobs across multiple environments (e.g., Node.js versions).
* Optimize workflows:
   * Use caching for dependencies.
   * Break workflows into reusable components.
* Integrate with DevOps tools:
  * Docker: Build and push images.
  * Kubernetes: Deploy using kubectl.
  * Terraform: Manage infrastructure as code1.
* Prepare for certification:
  * Author and maintain workflows and actions.
  * Consume workflows and manage GitHub Actions for enterprise
L3:
* Design scalable workflows:
  * Use self-hosted runners for custom environments.
  * Implement reusable workflows across repositories.
* Security and governance:
   * Enforce secrets management and access controls.
   * Audit workflows for vulnerabilities.
* Enterprise-level integration:
   * Manage GitHub Actions across teams and organizations.
   * Implement CI/CD across microservices and cloud platforms.
* Mentor and lead:
   * Guide teams in GitHub Actions best practices.
   * Contribute custom actions to the GitHub Marketplace

L1:

* Advanced Observability: Implement plugins for distributed tracing, anomaly detection, and predictive analytics .
* Strategic Optimization: Lead plugin-based observability initiatives aligned with SFIA levels and business KPIs.

Tools: Java (Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ (via Spring AMQP), ActiveMQ, JMS)

L1:
* Basic Understanding of Elixir: Familiar with syntax, basic data types, and simple pattern matching.
* Scheduling Concepts: Understands what scheduling means in a concurrent system; can use basic scheduling functions like Process.send_after/3.
* Middle Tier Awareness: Can work with basic business logic and understands the role of middle tier in a web application.
* Tool Usage: Uses IDEs for coding and basic debugging; relies on documentation for APIs.
* Testing: May write basic unit tests but relies on manual testing.
* Error Handling: Handles only the “happy path”; limited understanding of exceptions or process crashes
L2:
* Concurrency & Scheduling: Understands Elixir’s concurrency model (BEAM VM, lightweight processes); uses GenServer, Task, and Process modules effectively.
* Middle Tier Logic: Can design and implement moderately complex business logic; integrates with databases and external APIs.
* Code Organization: Applies modular design principles; organizes code across files and folders logically.
* Testing & Automation: Writes automated unit tests; familiar with TDD and uses tools like ExUnit.
* Error Handling: Implements basic fault tolerance using try/rescue, Supervisor trees.
* Performance Awareness: Begins to consider performance implications of scheduling and process spawning.
L3:
* Advanced Scheduling: Designs custom scheduling mechanisms using GenStage, Flow, or Oban for job processing.
* Middle Tier Architecture: Architects scalable and maintainable middle tier systems; applies Domain-Driven Design (DDD) and service boundaries.
* Concurrency Mastery: Deep understanding of BEAM internals, message passing, and process lifecycle; optimizes for throughput and fault tolerance.
* Testing Strategy: Implements full test suites including integration, performance, and fault injection tests.
* Error Resilience: Designs robust supervision trees; uses Registry, DynamicSupervisor, and custom recovery strategies.
* Tooling & Frameworks: Contributes to or builds frameworks; writes macros and metaprogramming constructs in Elixir.

L3:

* Uses advanced features like job lifecycle events, backoff strategies, and dead-letter queues.
* Integrates dashboards (e.g., Bull Board) for job monitoring.
* Writes comprehensive test suites including integration and performance tests.
* Suitable for high-scale systems (e.g., payment processing, video encoding, real-time alerts).

e-Trec / E-trec is an application to facilitate travel expense management & claim system for HUL field force.
 This is an in-house T&E application for field TSOs (Tertiary Sales Officers) in India who do not have an active valid id on global expense management system. E-trec Portal for field forces (TSOs) is being used for over 10 years, where employees raise their expense claims, which are approved by Line Manager (First level approval) and then approved by Audit Team (Second level approval by vendor Shreevathson’s team) and the payments are then disbursed by IBM.
